net.proteusframework.core.cache

Class JDBCCacheWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.cache.JDBCCacheWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    net.sf.ehcache.writer.CacheWriter

    public class JDBCCacheWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements net.sf.ehcache.writer.CacheWriter
    A CacheWriter that writes data to a database table. Assumes that toString() method on the keys used in this cache provides a good database identifier. Can be used in conjunction it with JDBCCacheLoader to implement a write-through or write-behind caching use-case. This writer does a no-op for CacheWriter.throwAway(Element, SingleOperationType, RuntimeException) which means that it should not be used for a use-case where the cache is being used to persist the master copy of any data. It is intended for use-cases where we want the cached data to be available to all JVM's in a cluster. It can also be used to have the cached data remain available across JVM restarts but the application should be able to recover from the cache being cleared.
    Author:
    Ken Logan (klogan@venturetech.net)
